intro: Byttneria catalpifolia subsp. sidifolia, commonly known as the slender byttneria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow or greenish-white. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in wetlands or along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
